duties_responsibilities.duty: Operate and maintain sludge, dewatering treatment, processing, disposal, and testing equipment to purify water and meet customer and state discharge permit requirements.
Independently operate assigned machines and equipment, meeting or exceeding processing, quality, and safety requirements.

Learn to operate equipment such as pumps, engines, centrifuge, generators, valves, gates, mixers, conveyors, blowers, dryers, chemical feed, sludge processing filters, belt presses, and testing equipment.
Utilize waste-water laboratory equipment and perform testing.
Work in a team environment and willingly assume additional responsibilities.

education_certification.credential: High School diploma or GED. Some experience in a related position and work environment is preferred. Ability to use computer programs for process control, read, and comprehend English, perform basic mathematical calculations, work in a team environment, and willingness to assume additional responsibilities. Must possess a valid driver’s license and a safe driving record. Ability to pass a drug test and a criminal background check. Ability to obtain certification to operate forklift and personnel lift.
